channel.title: swig on Fabrice Aneche
channel.description: Recent content in swig on Fabrice Aneche

item.title: C++ bindings in Go and Swig
item.description: Swig is a tool to generate bindings for c/c++, it can produce bindings for Python, Java, Go and more. Unfortunately the swig for Go is very limited, so as the Swig & Go documentation. Here are some notes taken while writing a binding from c++ to Go: To tranform standard types to Golang int64_t Ticks() const; %include "stdint.i" It will translate to Go func Ticks() int64 std::string as Go string
